API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.core.data.Point3D

type
class
version
3.1
since
0.1
A 3D coordinate.

A representation of a position in a 3D space.

Static Variables

UNIT_X(makeUnitX,null) : Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the X direction

UNIT_Y(makeUnitY,null) : Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the Y direction

UNIT_Z(makeUnitZ,null) : Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the Z direction

deserialize(default,method) : convertFrom : String -> Point3D

makeUnitX(default,method) : Void -> Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the X direction

makeUnitY(default,method) : Void -> Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the Y direction

makeUnitZ(default,method) : Void -> Point3D

Returns a new unit point in the Z direction

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_nX the x coordinate
p_nY the y coordinate
p_nZ the z coordinate
Creates a new vector instance.

Instance Variables

add(default,method) : v : Point3D -> Void

Adds a specified vector to this vector.

clone(default,method) : Void -> Point3D

Returns a clone of thei vector.

copy(default,method) : p_oPoint3D : Point3D -> Void

Makes this vector a copy of the specified vector.

All elements of this vector is set to those of the argument vector

cross(default,method) : v : Point3D -> Point3D

Computes and returns the cross between this vector and the specified vector.

crossWith(inline,null) : v : Point3D -> Void

Crosses this vector with the specified vector.

dot(default,method) : w : Point3D -> Float

Computes and returns the dot product between this vector and the specified vector.

equals(default,method) : p_vector : Point3D -> Bool

Is this vector equal to the specified vector?.

Compares this vector with the vector passed in the argument.
If all components in the two vectors are equal a value of true is returned.

getAngle(default,method) : w : Point3D -> Float

Returns the angle between this vector and the specified vector.

getMaxComponent(default,method) : Void -> Float

Gives the biggest component of the current vector. Example : var lMax:Float = new Point3D(5, 6.7, -4).getMaxComponent(); //returns 6.7

getMinComponent(default,method) : Void -> Float

Gives the smallest component of the current vector. Example : var lMin:Float = new Point3D(5, 6.7, -4).getMinComponent(); //returns -4

getNorm(default,method) : Void -> Float

Computes and returns the norm of this vector.

The norm of the vector is sqrt( x*x + y*y + z*z )

negate(default,method) : Void -> Point3D

Compute and returns the invers of this vector.

normalize(default,method) : Void -> Void

Normalizes this vector.

After normalizing the vector, the direction is the same, but the length is = 1.

pow(default,method) : pow : Float -> Void

Raises this vector to the specified power.

Each component of the vector is raised to the argument power.
So x = Math.pow( x, pow ), y = Math.pow( y, pow ),z = Math.pow( z, pow )

reset(default,method) : ?px : Float -> ?py : Float -> ?pz : Float -> Void

Reset the vector components to 0 after calling this method, x, y and z will be set to 0

resetToNegativeInfinity(default,method) : Void -> Void

Reset the vector components to the minimal value Flash can handle after calling this method, x, y and z will be set to Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;

resetToPositiveInfinity(default,method) : Void -> Void

Reset the vector components to the maximal value Flash can handle after calling this method, x, y and z will be set to Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;

scale(default,method) : n : Float -> Void

Multiplies this vector by the specified scalar.

serialize(default,method) : ?decPlaces : Int -> String

sub(default,method) : v : Point3D -> Void

Substracts the specified vector from this vector.

toString(default,method) : ?decPlaces : Int -> String

Returns a string representing this vector.

x : Float

The x coordinate.

y : Float

The y coordinate.

z : Float

The z coordinate.
